legacy_components.reason: Legacy web framework, should migrate to ASP.NET Core
legacy_components.impact: Cannot run on Linux, limited cloud deployment options, performance limitations

legacy_components.reason: WCF is not supported in .NET Core/.NET 5+, legacy SOAP service
legacy_components.impact: Must be replaced with modern alternatives (gRPC, REST API, or CoreWCF)

legacy_components.reason: Windows-only messaging, not available in .NET Core or cloud environments
legacy_components.impact: Must be replaced with cloud-native messaging (Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, etc.)

legacy_components.reason: System.Web is Windows/IIS-specific and not available in .NET Core
legacy_components.impact: Session management, HTTP context handling needs redesign
Should migrate to SDK-style project format
Should migrate to appsettings.json and modern configuration system

current: WCF service layer for business logic
issues: Session state won't scale in cloud

must_have: Replace ASP.NET MVC 5 with ASP.NET Core MVC or Razor Pages
Replace WCF with REST API or gRPC
Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus or similar
should_have: Add actual database (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.)

framework_migration.reason: .NET Framework 4.8.1 to .NET 10 is a major migration requiring significant code changes

wcf_replacement.reason: WCF has no direct replacement in .NET Core, requires architectural redesign

msmq_replacement.reason: MSMQ requires replacement with cloud messaging service, significant changes to message handling

mvc_migration.reason: ASP.NET MVC 5 to ASP.NET Core MVC is well-documented but requires careful migration

system_web_dependencies.reason: Session state and HTTP context handling need redesign

no_database.reason: No database to migrate, but adding one increases scope

complexity_analysis.justification: Score of 7 reflects high complexity due to: (1) WCF services requiring complete replacement with REST/gRPC, (2) MSMQ requiring migration to cloud messaging, (3) deep System.Web dependencies, (4) session state redesign needed for cloud, (5) major framework version jump. Mitigating factors: small codebase, no database to migrate, well-structured code, clear separation of concerns.

migration_strategy.approach: Incremental migration with parallel run capability

phases.name: Foundation
tasks: Set up project templates (ASP.NET Core, Web API)

phases.name: Data Layer
tasks: Implement repository pattern with proper interfaces

phases.name: Service Layer Migration
tasks: Replace WCF with ASP.NET Core Web API
Implement REST endpoints matching WCF operations
Implement proper error handling and validation

phases.name: Web Application Migration
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core MVC project
Update Razor views for ASP.NET Core
Update HTTP client to call REST API instead of WCF
Migrate static content and frontend assets

phases.name: Messaging Migration
tasks: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Update OrderQueueService to use Service Bus SDK
Migrate OrderProcessor to .NET 10 console app or Azure Function
Implement proper error handling and dead-lettering

phases.name: Cloud Deployment
tasks: Set up Azure Container Apps infrastructure
Set up Azure Service Bus namespace

risks: WCF to REST migration may uncover hidden dependencies
Session state migration may affect user experience
MSMQ to Service Bus requires careful testing of message handling
Azure costs for Service Bus and Container Apps
Learning curve for team on new technologies

recommended_technologies.database: Azure SQL Database or PostgreSQL (recommended addition)

supporting_services: Azure Service Bus (Standard or Premium tier)
Azure Cache for Redis (for session state)

estimated_costs.note: Costs are estimates and can be optimized with proper scaling policies

success_criteria: Successfully deployed to Azure Container Apps
Container images build and run successfully
Messages processed through Azure Service Bus
Session state works in distributed environment
Performance is equal or better than legacy version
breaking_changes: WCF endpoints will be replaced with REST API endpoints
MSMQ queue replaced with Azure Service Bus queue
Configuration file format changes (Web.config to appsettings.json)
Different hosting model (IIS to Container Apps)
notes: Application has clean architecture with good separation of concerns
No existing tests found - should add comprehensive test suite
No database - uses in-memory repository (consider adding real database)
Frontend uses modern Bootstrap 5 and jQuery - can be kept or modernized further
MSMQ dependency is the most challenging migration aspect
WCF can be replaced with simple REST API since operations are straightforward CRUD
OrderProcessor could potentially be an Azure Function instead of Container App
